definition: to wash/to clean out/to cleanse/to eliminate/to dredge
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Then the gold seekers had to move their supplies up the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 随后，这些淘金者还必须将他们的补给运过大山。

sentences.english: In nearby areas, gold mining has released mercury into the air and water.
sentences.chinese: 而在附近的地方，淘金者们向空气和水源还排放水银。

sentences.english: But China’s policymakers seem determined to disappoint fortune-hunters.
sentences.chinese: 但是中国决策者似乎让淘金者们失望了。

sentences.english: Thousands of gold seekers traveled to the Yukon through Alaska hoping to get rich.
sentences.chinese: 几千的希望暴富的淘金者穿过阿拉斯加到育空地区。

sentences.english: Gold had been found in Nome, Alaska. Thousands of people rushed to Nome.
sentences.chinese: 数以千计的淘金者又涌向了诺母。

sentences.english: These guys are goldminers. They decide to stay for a night.
sentences.chinese: 这些人是淘金者，决定在此度过一个晚上。

definition: to pan for gold/to try to make a fortune
